001package io.jstach.ezkv.kvs;
002
003import java.net.URI;
004import java.util.ArrayList;
005import java.util.Collection;
006import java.util.Comparator;
007import java.util.EnumSet;
008import java.util.HashMap;
009import java.util.Iterator;
010import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
011import java.util.List;
012import java.util.Map;
013import java.util.Map.Entry;
014import java.util.Optional;
015import java.util.SequencedCollection;
016import java.util.SequencedMap;
017import java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicInteger;
018import java.util.function.Function;
019import java.util.function.Predicate;
020import java.util.function.UnaryOperator;
021import java.util.stream.Collector;
022import java.util.stream.Collectors;
023import java.util.stream.Stream;
024
025import org.jspecify.annotations.Nullable;
026
027import io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.interpolate.Interpolator;
028import io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.interpolate.Interpolator.InterpolationException;
029import io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.interpolate.Interpolator.MissingVariableInterpolationException;
030
031/**
032 * Represents a collection of {@link KeyValue} entries with various utility methods for
033 * manipulation, transformation, and expansion. This interface serves as a central point
034 * for managing key-value pairs, allowing operations such as filtering, mapping, and
035 * interpolation.
036 *
037 * <p>
038 * KeyValues is basically a glorified {@code Supplier<Stream<KeyValue>>}. If the key
039 * values will be streamed multiple times it is recommended to call {@link #memoize()}
040 * which will copy the key values if the key values are not already memoized.
041 * </p>
042 *
043 *
044 * <h2>Key Features:</h2>
045 * <ul>
046 * <li>Provides methods for building key-value pairs with {@link Builder}.</li>
047 * <li>Supports functional transformations using {@link #map(UnaryOperator)},
048 * {@link #filter(Predicate)}, and {@link #flatMap(Function)}.</li>
049 * <li>Allows interpolation and expansion of values using variable substitution.</li>
050 * <li>Can convert key-values to a {@link Map} representation.</li>
051 * </ul>
052 *
053 * <h2>Usage Example:</h2> The following example demonstrates how to create, expand, and
054 * transform key-values:
055 *
056 * {@snippet :
057 * // Create a builder and add key-value pairs
058 * KeyValues.Builder builder = KeyValues.builder();
059 * builder.add("key1", "value1");
060 * builder.add("key2", "${key1}-${key3}");
061 *
062 * // Build the KeyValues collection
063 * KeyValues kvs = builder.build();
064 *
065 * // Interpolate values using a Variables map
066 * Variables variables = Variables.builder().add("key1", "interpolated").add("key3", "value3").build();
067 *
068 * KeyValues expanded = kvs.expand(variables);
069 *
070 * // Convert to a map
071 * Map<String, String> map = expanded.toMap();
072 * System.out.println(map); // {key1=value1, key2=value1-value3}
073 * }
074 *
075 * @see Variables
076 * @see KeyValues.Builder
077 * @see KeyValues#expand(Variables)
078 * @see KeyValues#toMap()
079 */
080public interface KeyValues extends Iterable<KeyValue> {
081
082        /**
083         * Returns a stream of the contained {@link KeyValue} entries.
084         * @return a {@link Stream} of key-value pairs.
085         */
086        public Stream<KeyValue> stream();
087
088        /**
089         * Creates a new {@link Builder} for constructing a {@code KeyValues} instance.
090         * @param resource a {@link KeyValuesResource} defining the source URI and reference
091         * key-value.
092         * @return a new {@link Builder}.
093         */
094        public static Builder builder(KeyValuesResource resource) {
095                return new Builder(resource.uri(), resource.reference());
096        }
097
098        /**
099         * Creates a new {@link Builder} with a default, empty source.
100         * @return a new {@link Builder}.
101         */
102        public static Builder builder() {
103                return new Builder(KeyValue.Source.NULL_URI, null);
104        }
105
106        /**
107         * Returns an empty {@code KeyValues} instance.
108         * @return an empty {@code KeyValues} collection.
109         */
110        public static KeyValues empty() {
111                return KeyValuesEmpty.EMPTY;
112        }
113
114        /**
115         * Creates a {@code KeyValues} instance by copying the given collection.
116         * @param kvs a {@link SequencedCollection} of key-value pairs.
117         * @return a new {@code KeyValues} instance containing the provided key-values.
118         */
119        public static KeyValues copyOf(SequencedCollection<KeyValue> kvs) {
120                return new ListKeyValues(List.copyOf(kvs));
121        }
122
123        /**
124         * Creates a single key values instance.
125         * @param keyValue single key value.
126         * @return keyvalues of one key value.
127         */
128        public static KeyValues of(KeyValue keyValue) {
129                return new ListKeyValues(List.of(keyValue));
130        }
131
132        /**
133         * A builder for constructing {@link KeyValues} instances from key-value pairs.
134         *
135         * <p>
136         * The builder is designed to create key-value pairs with associated metadata,
137         * including flags and source information. It supports adding entries both
138         * individually and from collections, and allows setting flags for all added entries.
139         * </p>
140         *
141         * <h2>Usage Example:</h2> The following example demonstrates how to use the builder:
142         *
143         * {@snippet :
144         * // Create a new builder
145         * KeyValues.Builder builder = KeyValues.builder();
146         *
147         * // Add key-value pairs
148         * builder.add("host", "localhost");
149         * builder.add("port", "8080");
150         * builder.flag(KeyValue.Flag.SENSITIVE);
151         *
152         * // Build the KeyValues instance
153         * KeyValues kvs = builder.build();
154         *
155         * // Convert to a map
156         * Map<String, String> map = kvs.toMap();
157         * System.out.println(map); // Output: {host=localhost, port=8080}
158         * }
159         */
160        public final class Builder {
161
162                private final URI source;
163
164                private final @Nullable KeyValue reference;
165
166                private final AtomicInteger index = new AtomicInteger();
167
168                private final List<KeyValue> keyValues = new ArrayList<>();
169
170                private final EnumSet<KeyValue.Flag> flags = EnumSet.noneOf(KeyValue.Flag.class);
171
172                private final boolean noSource;
173
174                /**
175                 * Constructs a new {@code Builder} with the specified source URI and reference.
176                 * @param source the URI representing the source of these key-values.
177                 * @param reference an optional reference {@link KeyValue}, can be {@code null}.
178                 */
179                private Builder(URI source, @Nullable KeyValue reference) {
180                        super();
181                        this.source = source;
182                        this.reference = reference;
183                        this.noSource = source.equals(KeyValue.Source.NULL_URI);
184                }
185
186                /**
187                 * Adds a flag that will be applied to all key-value pairs added by this builder.
188                 * @param flag the {@link KeyValue.Flag} to add.
189                 * @return this builder, for method chaining.
190                 */
191                public Builder flag(KeyValue.Flag flag) {
192                        flags.add(flag);
193                        return this;
194                }
195
196                /**
197                 * Adds a key-value pair to the builder.
198                 * @param key the key as a {@link String}.
199                 * @param value the value as a {@link String}.
200                 * @return this builder, for method chaining.
201                 */
202                public Builder add(String key, String value) {
203                        keyValues.add(build(key, value));
204                        return this;
205                }
206
207                /**
208                 * Adds a key-value pair to the builder from a map entry.
209                 * @param e a {@link java.util.Map.Entry} representing the key and value.
210                 * @return this builder, for method chaining.
211                 */
212                public Builder add(Entry<String, String> e) {
213                        return add(e.getKey(), e.getValue());
214                }
215
216                @SuppressWarnings("null") // Eclipse null analysis has some inference issue here
217                private static final Comparator<Entry<String, String>> entryComparator = Map.Entry
218                        .<String, String>comparingByKey()
219                        .thenComparing(Entry::getValue);
220
221                /**
222                 * Adds a collection of entries to the builder. The entries are added in the order
223                 * they appear in the collection.
224                 * @param entries a {@link SequencedCollection} of entries to add.
225                 * @return this builder, for method chaining.
226                 */
227                public Builder add(SequencedCollection<Entry<String, String>> entries) {
228                        for (var e : entries) {
229                                add(e);
230                        }
231                        return this;
232                }
233
234                /**
235                 * Adds a collection of entries to the builder.
236                 *
237                 * <p>
238                 * If the collection is a {@link SequencedCollection}, the entries are added in
239                 * the original order of the collection. Otherwise, the entries are first sorted
240                 * lexicographically by key and then by value before being added.
241                 * </p>
242                 * @param entries a {@link Collection} of entries to add.
243                 * @return this builder, for method chaining.
244                 */
245                public Builder add(Collection<Entry<String, String>> entries) {
246                        switch (entries) {
247                                case SequencedCollection<Entry<String, String>> sc -> add(sc);
248                                default -> entries.stream().sorted(entryComparator).forEach(this::add);
249                        }
250                        ;
251                        return this;
252                }
253
254                /**
255                 * Constructs a {@link KeyValue} with the given key and value, including flags and
256                 * source information.
257                 * @param key the key as a {@link String}.
258                 * @param value the value as a {@link String}.
259                 * @return a new {@link KeyValue} with the specified key, value, and metadata.
260                 */
261                public KeyValue build(String key, String value) {
262                        var s = noSource ? KeyValue.Source.EMPTY : new KeyValue.Source(source, reference, index.incrementAndGet());
263                        var m = KeyValue.Meta.of(key, value, s, flags);
264                        return new KeyValue(key, value, m);
265                }
266
267                /**
268                 * Builds and returns a {@link KeyValues} instance containing all the key-value
269                 * pairs added to this builder.
270                 * @return a new {@link KeyValues} instance.
271                 */
272                public KeyValues build() {
273                        return KeyValues.copyOf(keyValues);
274                }
275
276        }
277
278        /**
279         * Collects a stream of {@link KeyValue} into a {@code KeyValues} instance.
280         * @return a {@link Collector} that accumulates key-values into a {@code KeyValues}
281         * object.
282         */
283        public static Collector<KeyValue, ?, KeyValues> collector() {
284                return Collectors.collectingAndThen(Collectors.toList(), KeyValues::copyOf);
285        }
286
287        /**
288         * Collects a stream of {@link java.util.Map.Entry} into a {@code KeyValues} using the
289         * provided builder.
290         * @param builder the {@link Builder} to use for constructing the key-values.
291         * @return a {@link Collector} that accumulates entries into a {@code KeyValues}
292         * object.
293         */
294        public static Collector<Map.Entry<String, String>, ?, KeyValues> collector(Builder builder) {
295                return Collector.of(() -> builder,
296                                // Accumulator: add each entry to the builder
297                                (b, entry) -> b.add(entry),
298                                // Combiner: combine two builders (can be ignored if the stream is
299                                // sequential)
300                                (b1, b2) -> {
301                                        throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Parallel streams not supported");
302                                },
303                                // Finisher: call build on the final builder
304                                Builder::build);
305        }
306
307        @Override
308        default Iterator<KeyValue> iterator() {
309                return stream().iterator();
310        }
311
312        /**
313         * Applies a transformation function to each key-value pair in the collection.
314         * @param kv a {@link UnaryOperator} to transform each key-value.
315         * @return a new {@code KeyValues} with transformed entries.
316         */
317        default KeyValues map(UnaryOperator<KeyValue> kv) {
318                return ToStringableKeyValues.of(() -> stream().map(kv));
319        }
320
321        /**
322         * Filters the key-value pairs based on a predicate.
323         * @param predicate a {@link Predicate} to test each key-value.
324         * @return a new {@code KeyValues} with filtered entries.
325         */
326        default KeyValues filter(Predicate<KeyValue> predicate) {
327                return ToStringableKeyValues.of(() -> stream().filter(predicate));
328        }
329
330        /**
331         * This method gets the last element of the key values stream. This ergonomic is
332         * provided because later keys override earlier keys of the same name.
333         * @return optional of the last key value if there is one.
334         */
335        default Optional<KeyValue> last() {
336                KeyValue last = null;
337                for (var kv : this) {
338                        last = kv;
339                }
340                return Optional.ofNullable(last);
341        }
342
343        /**
344         * Flattens the key-values by applying a mapping function that returns another
345         * {@code KeyValues}.
346         * @param func a function that transforms a {@link KeyValue} into another
347         * {@code KeyValues}.
348         * @return a new flattened {@code KeyValues}.
349         */
350        default KeyValues flatMap(Function<KeyValue, KeyValues> func) {
351                var f = func.andThen(KeyValues::stream);
352                return ToStringableKeyValues.of(() -> stream().flatMap(f));
353        }
354
355        /**
356         * Interpolates the values using the provided {@link Variables}. The key value pairs
357         * in <code>this</code> take precedence over the passed in variables such that if
358         * there is a matching key in this and in variables the value of the key value in this
359         * will be used.
360         * @param variables a {@link Variables} map for value substitution.
361         * @return a map of interpolated key-values.
362         * @see #expand(Variables)
363         * @see #toMap()
364         */
365        default Map<String, String> interpolate(Variables variables) {
366                return expand(variables).toMap();
367        }
368
369        /**
370         * Expands the key-values using variable interpolation and return a new key values
371         * where all the value parts of the keys are replaced with the interpolation results.
372         * @param variables a {@link Variables} map for value substitution.
373         * @return a new {@code KeyValues} with expanded values.
374         * @see Variables#empty()
375         */
376        default KeyValues expand(Variables variables) {
377                return KeyValuesInterpolator.interpolateKeyValues(this, variables, false);
378        }
379
380        /**
381         * Returns a memoized version of this {@code KeyValues} which means repeated calls to
382         * iteratore or stream over the KeyValues will always generate the same result.
383         * @return a memoized {@code KeyValues} instance.
384         */
385        default KeyValues memoize() {
386                if (this instanceof MemoizedKeyValues mkvs) {
387                        return mkvs;
388                }
389                return copyOf(stream().toList());
390        }
391
392        /**
393         * Redacts sensitive key-value entries by replacing their values.
394         * @return a new {@code KeyValues} with redacted entries.
395         */
396        default KeyValues redact() {
397                return this.map(KeyValue::redact);
398        }
399
400        /**
401         * Converts the key-values to a map where each key maps to its expanded value. The
402         * returned Map is sequenced based on the order of the key-values. <strong>Note this
403         * call does not do any interpolation!</strong> If interpolation is desired it needs
404         * to be done prior with {@link #expand(Variables)} or {@link #interpolate(Variables)}
405         * should be used.
406         * @return a {@link Map} of key-value pairs.
407         */
408        default SequencedMap<String, String> toMap() {
409                SequencedMap<String, String> m = new LinkedHashMap<>();
410                stream().forEach(kv -> m.put(kv.key(), kv.expanded()));
411                return m;
412        }
413
414        /**
415         * A convenience method to format key values to a String mainly for unit testing to
416         * maintain fluent chain.
417         * @param media which will be used to call {@link KeyValuesMedia#formatter()}
418         * @return formatted key values
419         * @throws UnsupportedOperationException if formatting is not supported by the media.
420         * @see KeyValuesMedia#ofProperties()
421         */
422        default String format(KeyValuesMedia media) throws UnsupportedOperationException {
423                return media.formatter().format(this);
424        }
425
426        // TODO multiMap SequencedMap<String, List<String>>
427
428}
429
430interface ToStringableKeyValues extends KeyValues {
431
432        static KeyValues of(KeyValues kvs) {
433                if (kvs instanceof ToStringableKeyValues t) {
434                        return t;
435                }
436                return new PrintableKeyValues(kvs);
437
438        }
439
440        static String toString(KeyValues keyValues) {
441                StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
442                var kvs = keyValues.redact();
443                sb.append("KeyValues[").append("\n");
444                KeyValuesMedia.ofProperties().formatter().format(sb, kvs);
445                sb.append("]").append("\n");
446                return sb.toString();
447        }
448
449}
450
451interface MemoizedKeyValues extends KeyValues {
452
453}
454
455record PrintableKeyValues(KeyValues values) implements ToStringableKeyValues {
456        @Override
457        public Stream<KeyValue> stream() {
458                return values.stream();
459        }
460
461        @Override
462        public String toString() {
463                return ToStringableKeyValues.toString(this);
464        }
465}
466
467record ListKeyValues(List<KeyValue> keyValues) implements ToStringableKeyValues, MemoizedKeyValues {
468
469        ListKeyValues {
470                keyValues = List.copyOf(keyValues);
471        }
472
473        @Override
474        public Stream<KeyValue> stream() {
475                return keyValues.stream();
476        }
477
478        @Override
479        public Iterator<KeyValue> iterator() {
480                return keyValues.iterator();
481        }
482
483        @Override
484        public KeyValues memoize() {
485                return this;
486        }
487
488        @Override
489        public Optional<KeyValue> last() {
490                if (keyValues.isEmpty()) {
491                        return Optional.empty();
492                }
493                return Optional.of(keyValues.getLast());
494        }
495
496        @Override
497        public final String toString() {
498                return ToStringableKeyValues.toString(this);
499        }
500}
501
502class KeyValuesInterpolator {
503
504        static KeyValues interpolateKeyValues(final KeyValues keyValues, final Variables variables, boolean local) {
505                // local flag indicates all the key values
506                // are from the same resource.
507                List<KeyValue> kvs = keyValues.stream().toList();
508
509                final Map<String, KeyValue> flat = new HashMap<>(kvs.size());
510                kvs.forEach(kv -> flat.put(kv.key(), kv));
511
512                final Map<String, String> resolved = new LinkedHashMap<>(kvs.size());
513
514                Variables combined = Variables.builder().add(k -> {
515                        var f = flat.get(k);
516                        if (f != null) {
517                                return f.raw();
518                        }
519                        return null;
520
521                }).add(resolved).add(variables).build();
522                @SuppressWarnings("null")
523                Interpolator sub = Interpolator.create((key) -> {
524                        return combined.getValue(key);
525                });
526                List<KeyValue> expanded = new ArrayList<>();
527
528                for (KeyValue kv : kvs) {
529                        KeyValue last = flat.remove(kv.key());
530
531                        String value;
532                        /*
533                         * We allow sensitive to be interpolated locally. The assumption here is when
534                         * the local flag is passed all the key values passed are from the same
535                         * resource.
536                         */
537                        if (kv.isNoInterpolation() || (kv.isSensitive() && !local)) {
538                                value = kv.value();
539                        }
540                        else {
541                                String v = kv.raw();
542                                try {
543                                        value = (v.indexOf('$') != -1) ? sub.interpolate(kv.key(), v) : v;
544                                }
545                                catch (MissingVariableInterpolationException e) {
546                                        throw e;
547                                }
548                                catch (InterpolationException e) {
549                                        // TODO this was old code that may not long be applicable.
550                                        String r = resolved.get(kv.key());
551                                        if (r == null) {
552                                                r = kv.expanded();
553                                        }
554                                        value = r;
555                                }
556                        }
557                        expanded.add(kv.withExpanded(value));
558                        resolved.put(kv.key(), value);
559                        if (last != null) {
560                                flat.put(kv.key(), last);
561                        }
562
563                }
564
565                return KeyValues.copyOf(expanded);
566        }
567
568}
569
570enum KeyValuesEmpty implements KeyValues, ToStringableKeyValues {
571
572        EMPTY;
573
574        @Override
575        public Stream<KeyValue> stream() {
576                return Stream.empty();
577        }
578
579        @Override
580        public String toString() {
581                return "KeyValues[]";
582        }
583
584}
